description: Hello all, and warm welcome to Edinburgh University Clarinet Choir’s Winter Concert 2019!

After a last-minute scramble for rehearsal space at the beginning of the semester, the Choir has grown in both size and spirit, welcoming almost 20 new members to our ranks so far! We’ve been having an absolute blast over the last three months with our weekly rehearsals, board game nights, group meals, pub crawls and busking sessions out and around Edinburgh.

Tonight, we have a wide range of music for you to enjoy - everything from English folk songs to K-pop, as well as a plethora of arrangements from both our own members and our fabulous conductor and Musical Director, Beth Appelquist. There should be something for everybody, so we hope you’re as excited to get started as we are!

During the break, we’re hosting a bake sale by donation in support of the Bethany Christian Trust’s Care Shelter. Every year, the Bethany Christian Trust (SC003783) along with around 1,000 volunteers from across Edinburgh and the Lothians provide shelter and hot meals to hundreds of homeless during the winter months. It deeply saddens me to think of those left out on the street alone, especially as we approach our winter celebrations, so I would like to thank each and every one of you who is able to make a donation tonight of whatever is within your means.

conductor.title: Musical Director
conductor.name: Beth Appelquist
description: Beth is a graduate Physics and Music student from the University of Edinburgh and is now studying Sound For Moving Image at the Glasgow School of Art. A clarinettist (among many other instruments) herself, she brings expertise, energy and enthusiasm to rehearsals, as well as tirelessly helping with the social aspects and running of the society. She has been conducting Clarinet Choir since 2017.

pieces.title: One in a Million
pieces.composer: Sebastian Thott, Didrik Thott, Andreas Öberg, Danielle Senior, mr. cho

postroll.stream: Thanks for Watching! Don't forget to check out our social media profiles!
